text:
* England cricket legend Jimmy Anderson is being considered for a £135,000 deal to play in the MLC tournament in the USA.
* The MLC has completed its second season, and teams are interested in signing Anderson for the next season.
* The league has already attracted high-profile players like Australia captain Pat Cummins, who has a contract with the San Francisco Unicorns until 2027.
* Other Australian players like Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, and Travis Head play for Washington Freedom, who won the MLC this year.
* The MLC has influential backers, including Microsoft chief executive Satya Nadella, and has pursued big-name players like England World Cup winners Liam Plunkett and Jason Roy.
* The league is set to expand to 34 games next year, having been granted official List A status in May.
* Anderson has expressed interest in playing franchise cricket, despite not having played a competitive T20 match since 2014.

* One of the MLC franchises is interested in signing former England pacer James Anderson for the next edition of the league.
* If Anderson signs a deal, he could earn around 1,35,000 euros for a short stint in the competition.
* Major League Cricket is set to expand from 19 to 34 games in 2025.
* Other players who are already part of the MLC or have featured in previous editions include Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, Liam Plunkett, and Jason Roy.

* GMR Group has acquired a team in the Hampshire cricket league, expanding their cricket portfolio which already includes teams in the Indian Premier League (IPL), UAE's ILT20, and USA's Major League Cricket.

* A Major League Cricket (MLC) team is interested in signing former England cricketer James Anderson for the 2025 season.
* This would mark Anderson's return to T20 cricket after a decade-long hiatus.
* No further details are provided about the MLC team or the terms of the potential signing.
* The article does not mention any other players or teams involved in the MLC tournament.

* Legendary England pacer James Anderson is considering playing in the MLC in the United States, following his retirement from international cricket.
* At least one MLC franchise is interested in signing Anderson, who is open to playing white-ball cricket, particularly in the 2025 edition of the tournament.
* The MLC has gained credibility in the global cricket scene, attracting notable internationals like Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, and Glenn Maxwell, and has been granted official List A status.
* The league is expanding to 34 games in 2025, making it an attractive opportunity for Anderson and other cricketers.
* Playing in the MLC could yield significant financial benefits for Anderson, with reports suggesting earnings of around 135,000 euros for a brief tenure, compared to the England and Wales Cricket Board's white-ball contract valued at 70,000 euros.

* James Anderson, England's most successful Test bowler, may return to T20 cricket and is being considered for a role in the 2025 season of Major League Cricket (MLC) in the United States.
* Anderson has been shortlisted by MLC franchises due to his impressive Test record, which includes 704 wickets, and his ability to adapt to varying conditions.
* The MLC has been expanding rapidly and has already attracted top international cricketers such as Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, and Travis Head.
* Anderson is expected to be paid around Rs 1.49 crore (approximately 135,000 euros) for his tenure with the MLC.
* The MLC has expanded from 19 games to 34 games in 2025, providing a significant opportunity for players like Anderson to feature prominently.
* Anderson's return to T20 cricket would be a significant addition to the league and could inspire young cricketers, gaining more attention for the MLC.

Note: The summary only includes information specific to the Major League Cricket tournament and James Anderson's potential involvement in it.

* Senior figures from an unnamed MLC team are interested in recruiting James Anderson, England's all-time leading Test wicket-taker, for the 2024 edition of the tournament.
* Anderson, 42, could potentially earn around £135,000 for a brief stint in MLC.
* The tournament has already attracted top names, including Australia's captain Pat Cummins, who signed a lucrative contract with the San Francisco Unicorns until 2027.
* Other high-profile players who participated in the 2023 tournament include Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, and Travis Head, who were part of the Washington Freedom team led by coach Ricky Ponting, which won the tournament.
* The 2024 edition of MLC is scheduled to take place next year in the United States.

* James Anderson, England's all-time leading Test wicket-taker, is being considered as a potential recruit for the 2025 MLC season.
* Senior figures from at least one MLC franchise are exploring Anderson's interest in participating in the tournament.
* Anderson had previously hinted at a possible return to white-ball cricket, which caught the attention of MLC.
* If Anderson joins, he could earn around 1,35,000 euros for a short stint in the competition.
* MLC has successfully attracted high-profile names in the past, including Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, and Travis Head.
* The tournament is set to expand from 19 to 34 games in 2025.
* MLC has shown interest in luring top English talent to the league, with previous participants including Liam Plunkett and Jason Roy, who signed a lucrative two-year deal with the Los Angeles Knight Riders.
